column4: The package management system -- apt-get and so forth -- is really good about maintaining the integrity of packages, i.e., applications and their supporting files.
IMHO, package management systems and software repositories are the biggest advantage of Debian-based and Red Hat-based Linux distributions over Windows and OS X.
almost all major *nix distros have some kind of package manager
true. I think the deb and rpm systems are the best, though.
